name: Chicken tikka masala
description: Creamy, tangy curry with broiled chicken
directions: Marinate chicken in chicken marinade for at least 4 hours.
In a large dutch oven, add oil. Add onions and stir for 5-8 mins until translucent.
Add garlic and ginger. Toast for 1-2 mins.
Add spices. Toast for 30 seconds.
Add tomato paste. Stir for 1 minute.
Add whole peeled tomatoes. Deglaze the dutch oven with tomato juices.
Add heavy cream. Stir and let simmer for ~15 mins.
Meanwhile, broil chicken. ~10 mins skin side up, ~5 mins skin side down.
Add broiled chicken to dutch oven. Let simmer for additional ~30 mins.
Check for consistency and salt as needed. Garnish with cilantro and serve.

name: Hong Kong-style milk tea
description: Overbrewed but malty, with condensed milk
directions: Firstly, make tea concentrate: add water and tea leaves to saucepan.
Turn heat to high, and when at a rolling boil, lower the heat to low and cap the saucepan. Let steep for 10 minutes.
Strain tea. Reserve 1/2 cup for next steps.
Heat 1/2 cup of tea until boiling. Immediately add to cup along with evapo milk and condensed milk.
For extra frothiness, naturally aerate the milk tea by pouring it back and forth between two vessels. Serve.

name: Chocolate chip cookies
description: Buttery and crisp, adapted from ATK
directions: Heat butter in pan over medium heat until golden brown, about 10 mins. Transfer to large bowl.
Whisk together flour and baking soda in separate bowl.
In the butter bowl, add sugars, salt, and vanilla. Whisk.
Add eggs and whisk.
Add flour mixture and mix until well incorporated.
Add choco chips.
Refrigerate cookie dough for at least 1 hour. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 375F.
Shape cookie dough into 1 oz portions.
Bake for 16 mins in oven.
Serve.

name: Spicy poke
description: Classic spicy ahi poke, inspired by Foodland
ingredients: 1 lb ahi (yellowfin tuna), diced into cubes
directions: Mix onion slices into tuna
Whisk soy sauce, kewpie, and sriracha together.
Add sauce mixture to tuna and mix. Take care not to roughen up the tuna too much.
Add sesame oil, green onions, and salt to taste.

name: Taco chicken
directions: Sift all dry ingredients together.
Add oil to chicken, then dry ingredients. Rub into chicken.
Marinate for at least 4 hours.
Broil chicken for ~10 mins skin-side up, then flip and broil for ~5 mins skin-side down.
Remove from oven and slice into strips. Serve.

name: Orange sauce
description: A creamy, garlicky sauce with as much spice as you want
ingredients: 0.5 lb Roma tomatoes, sliced into chunks
6 chile de arbol (or more for add'l spice)
directions: Broil Roma tomatoes and onions for 10-15 minutes until lightly browned.
Meanwhile, pan fry garlic and chile de arbol until well toasted.
Add solid ingredients into blender. Blend until no large pieces.
While blender is running, add oil in a continuous stream.
Add salt and continue blending until consistency is as desired.

name: Green sauce
description: Fresh and garlicky, the orange sauce's cooler cousin
directions: Broil tomatillos and onions for 10-15 minutes until lightly browned.
Meanwhile, pan fry garlic until well toasted.
Add solid ingredients into blender. Blend until no large pieces.
While blender is running, add oil in a continuous stream.
Add salt and continue blending until consistency is as desired.

name: Thai fried rice
description: Delicate fried rice with a pop of fish sauce
directions: Coat chicken in chicken marinade. Let marinate for 10 mins.
Heat up wok to high heat.
Add 1 tbs oil and chicken.
Stir fry chicken until no longer pink. Reserve and set aside.
Reduce heat to low and add shallots and garlic. Stir fry until light browned.
Add eggs. Heat until set in a thin layer.
Add rice and turn heat to high.
Stir fry rice. Keep adding oil as needed. Once rice kernels are well dispersed, add cooked chicken.
Add fish sauce, soy sauce, and sugar. Stir fry until well incorporated.
Add green onions and serve.
